desc_content.paragraph: Image data-block referencing an external or packed image
Representation of alpha information in the RGBA pixels

list_item.paragraph: STRAIGHT Straight, Transparent RGB and alpha pixels are unmodified.
PREMUL Premultiplied, Transparent RGB pixels are multiplied by the alpha channel.

desc_content.paragraph: OpenGL bindcode
Number of channels in pixels buffer
Input color space settings
Image bit depth
Display Aspect for this image, does not affect rendering

field_body.paragraph: float array of 2 items in [0.1, inf], default (0.0, 0.0)

desc_content.paragraph: Format used for re-saving this file

list_item.paragraph: BMP BMP, Output image in bitmap format.
IRIS Iris, Output image in (old!) SGI IRIS format.
PNG PNG, Output image in PNG format.
JPEG JPEG, Output image in JPEG format.
TARGA Targa, Output image in Targa format.
TARGA_RAW Targa Raw, Output image in uncompressed Targa format.
CINEON Cineon, Output image in Cineon format.
DPX DPX, Output image in DPX format.
OPEN_EXR_MULTILAYER OpenEXR MultiLayer, Output image in multilayer OpenEXR format.
OPEN_EXR OpenEXR, Output image in OpenEXR format.
HDR Radiance HDR, Output image in Radiance HDR format.
TIFF TIFF, Output image in TIFF format.
AVI_JPEG AVI JPEG, Output video in AVI JPEG format.
AVI_RAW AVI Raw, Output video in AVI Raw format.
FFMPEG FFmpeg video, The most versatile way to output video files.

desc_content.paragraph: Image/Movie file name
Image/Movie file name (without data refreshing)
Duration (in frames) of the image (1 when not a video/sequence)
Fill color for the generated image

field_body.paragraph: float array of 4 items in [0, inf], default (0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)

desc_content.paragraph: Generated image height
Generated image type

list_item.paragraph: BLANK Blank, Generate a blank image.
UV_GRID UV Grid, Generated grid to test UV mappings.
COLOR_GRID Color Grid, Generated improved UV grid to test UV mappings.

desc_content.paragraph: Generated image width
True if the image data is loaded into memory
Image has changed and is not saved
True if this image is stored in float buffer
Image has more than one view
Image has left and right views
First packed file of the image
Collection of packed images
Image pixels in floating point values
Render slots of the image
X/Y pixels per meter

field_body.paragraph: float array of 2 items in [-inf, inf], default (0.0, 0.0)

desc_content.paragraph: Width and height in pixels, zero when image data cant be loaded

field_body.paragraph: int array of 2 items in [-inf, inf], default (0, 0), (readonly)

desc_content.paragraph: Where the image comes from

list_item.paragraph: FILE Single Image, Single image file.
SEQUENCE Image Sequence, Multiple image files, as a sequence.
MOVIE Movie, Movie file.
GENERATED Generated, Generated image.
VIEWER Viewer, Compositing node viewer.

desc_content.paragraph: Settings for stereo 3d
How to generate the image
Use the alpha channel information from the image or make image fully opaque
Deinterlace movie file on load
Generate floating point buffer
Use Multiple Views (when available)
Apply render part of display transformation when displaying this image on the screen
Mode to load image views

list_item.paragraph: INDIVIDUAL Individual, Individual files for each view with the prefix as defined by the scene views.
STEREO_3D Stereo 3D, Single file with an encoded stereo pair.

desc_content.paragraph: Save image to a specific path using a scenes render settings

list_item.paragraph: filepath (string, (never None)) – Save path
scene (Scene, (optional)) – Scene to take image parameters from

desc_content.paragraph: Save image to its source path
Pack an image as embedded data into the .blend file

list_item.paragraph: as_png (boolean, (optional)) – as_png, Pack the image as PNG (needed for generated/dirty images)
data (string, (optional, never None)) – data, Raw data (bytes, exact content of the embedded file)
data_len (int in [0, inf], (optional)) – data_len, length of given data (mandatory if data is provided)

desc_content.paragraph: Save an image packed in the .blend file to disk

field_body.paragraph: method (enum in ['USE_LOCAL', 'WRITE_LOCAL', 'USE_ORIGINAL', 'WRITE_ORIGINAL'], (optional)) – method, How to unpack

desc_content.paragraph: Reload the image from its source path
Update the display image from the floating point buffer
Scale the image in pixels

list_item.paragraph: width (int in [1, 10000]) – Width
height (int in [1, 10000]) – Height

desc_content.paragraph: Delay the image from being cleaned from the cache due inactivity

list_item.paragraph: frame (int in [0, inf], (optional)) – Frame, Frame of image sequence or movie
filter (int in [-inf, inf], (optional)) – Filter, The texture minifying function to use if the image wasn’t loaded
mag (int in [-inf, inf], (optional)) – Magnification, The texture magnification function to use if the image wasn’t loaded

desc_content.paragraph: Load the image into OpenGL graphics memory

list_item.paragraph: frame (int in [0, inf], (optional)) – Frame, Frame of image sequence or movie
filter (int in [-inf, inf], (optional)) – Filter, The texture minifying function
mag (int in [-inf, inf], (optional)) – Magnification, The texture magnification function

desc_content.paragraph: Free the image from OpenGL graphics memory
Return the absolute path to the filepath of an image frame specified by the image user

field_body.paragraph: image_user (ImageUser, (optional)) – Image user of the image to get filepath for
File Path, The resulting filepath from the image and it’s user

desc_content.paragraph: Free the image buffers from memory

field_body.paragraph: The RNA type or default when not found.
The class or default when not found.
